LanguageData.AlertLowHemogenDesc:
A colonist has low haemogen. At zero haemogen, they will develop a painful haemogen craving.

Feed them haemogen packs to prevent this. You can obtain haemogen packs using the 'extract haemogen pack' medical operation on a non-haemogenic human.

The following colonists have low haemogen
LanguageData.NotAllowedHemogen: Haemogen packs disabled by food restriction.
LanguageData.MessagePawnHadNotEnoughBloodToProduceHem: {PAWN_nameDef} did not have enough blood to produce a haemogen pack.
LanguageData.MessageCannotStartHemogenExtraction: {PAWN_nameDef} doesn't have enough blood to produce a haemogen pack.
LanguageData.HemogenDesc: Haemogen is a biological energy source derived from compounds in human blood. Baseliner humans produce it endogenously and consume it over time in their own internal balance. Some human xenotypes use it as a kind of fuel for specific abilities, while others must consume it to survive at all.
LanguageData.CannotWakeNotEnoughHemogen: Cannot wake. Need at least {0} haemogen.
LanguageData.AutoTakeHemogenDesc: This determines whether {PAWN_nameDef} will automatically ingest haemogen packs when {PAWN_possessive} haemogen is below {MIN}.\n\nAutomatic ingestion is currently {ONOFF}.
